ai.summary: A 7.2 km moderate hike on Barnes Trail Extension in the UK, combining gentle climbs with flat sections and varied scenery. Suitable for hikers with intermediate experience seeking steady footing and countryside views.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain with well-defined paths, firm dirt and gravel, and occasional muddy stretches. Expect exposed roots, grassy sections, hedgerows, and small gradients; footing is generally steady but can be uneven in places.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather and daylight hours. Wear sturdy footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked trails, be mindful of livestock in rural sections, and carry enough water and snacks. Have a map or GPS, a charged phone, and let someone know your route and ETA. In remote sections mobile signal can be limited; consider starting earlier in the day.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for longer daylight and drier conditions. Winter hikes are possible but can be muddy, icy, and more challenging.

seo.title: Barnes Trail Extension Hike Guide | 7.2 km Moderate UK Trail
seo.meta_description: Explore Barnes Trail Extension, a 7.2 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and essential gear for this countryside walk.
